name: collections::btree::node::Handle::<collections::btree::node::NodeRef<collections::btree::node::marker::Mut<'a>, K, V, collections::btree::node::marker::Internal>, collections::btree::node::marker::Edge>::correct_parent_link

collections::btree::node::NodeRef::<Borr.doc:
Exposes the data of an internal node.

 Returns a raw ptr to avoid invalidating other references to this node.

collections::btree::node::Handle::<colle.doc:
Finds the node pointed to by this edge.

 The method name assumes you picture trees with the root node on top.

 `edge.descend().ascend().unwrap()` and `node.ascend().unwrap().descend()` should
 both, upon success, do nothing.

collections::btree::node::NodeRef::<coll.doc:
Sets the node's link to its parent edge,
 without invalidating other references to the node.

doc:
Fixes the parent pointer and index in the child node that this edge
 links to. This is useful when the ordering of edges has been changed,
